title: DIFFVOX: A Differentiable Model for Capturing and Analysing Professional Effects Distributions
author: Chin-Yun Yu (Centre for Digital Music, Queen Mary University of London), Marco A. Martínez-Ramírez (Sony AI), Junghyun Koo (Sony AI), Ben Hayes (Centre for Digital Music, Queen Mary University of London), Wei-Hsiang Liao (Sony AI), György Fazekas (Centre for Digital Music, Queen Mary University of London), Yuki Mitsufuji (Sony Group Corporation), ...
relevance_why: The paper presents a differentiable model which could be beneficial for audio processing tasks such as music source separation or restoration, relevant to Haohe's work on audio enhancement.
background: This research develops a model for effectively optimizing and capturing vocal effects used in music production through gradient-based methods.
contribution: DIFFVOX introduces a differentiated approach to model vocal effects and analyze their parameter distributions, achieving better insights into audio processing practices.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous frameworks often utilized non-informative priors or lacked direct optimization of effects parameters.
technical_comparison.novelty: DIFFVOX enables end-to-end optimization of vocal effects through differentiable implementations, providing more accurate and nuanced controls.

key_innovation: The integration of gradient-based optimization within vocal effects processing allows for real-time adjustments and enhanced parameter exploration.
real_world_impact: The method enhances the production quality in music, enabling automatic mixing processes and potentially revolutionizing audio effect applications in both professional and home settings.
limitations: The model does not account for non-linear effects or heavy automation found in complex mixes.

new_terms.differentiable: **Differentiable** refers to the capability of a function to have a derivative, allowing for the computation of gradients which is essential for optimization in machine learning.
new_terms.parameterization: **Parameterization** is the process of defining a mathematical description of a model using parameters that can be tuned for optimization.

open_sourcing: The source code and vocal presets dataset are available at https://github.com/SonyResearch/diffvox
